title: install trinity failed
body:
* py-evm Version: none
* OS: osx
* Python Version (python --version): Python 3.6.5
* Environment (output of `pip freeze`):

### What is wrong?

when I install Trinity by
```
python3 -m pip install -U trinity
```
failed and output with:

```
Collecting eth-utils<2.0.0,>=1.3.0b0 (from py-evm[p2p,trinity]==0.2.0a33->trinity)
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement eth-utils<2.0.0,>=1.3.0b0 (from py-evm[p2p,trinity]==0.2.0a33->trinity) (from versions: 0.7.0, 0.7.1, 0.7.2, 0.7.3, 0.7.4, 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 1.0.0b1, 1.0.0b2, 1.0.1, 1.0.2, 1.0.3, 1.1.1, 1.1.2, 1.2.0, 1.2.1, 1.2.2, 2.0.0a0)
No matching distribution found for eth-utils<2.0.0,>=1.3.0b0 (from py-evm[p2p,trinity]==0.2.0a33->trinity)
```

Note: I have configured a pip mirror:

at `$HOME/.pip/pip.conf`

```
[global]
index-url = https://pypi.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/simple
```


### How can it be fixed
this problem may be caused by pip mirror, I fixed this by changing the mirror.
